divs: sighting detailson sunday 4\11\10 i was out feeding my dogs in my backyard at around 10:18 pm. i tend to face the western sky when i fill their food bowls and i tend to look at the sky while getting their food ready or giving them water. this time i noticed a bright light in the western sky. at first i thought it was a plane but then realized that it was stationary and as bright as the light was, i would have clearly seen any movement had it been a moving object. after feeding the dogs and viewing the object for about 20 minutes i decided that there was no way it was a plane and decided to video tape the stationary light. i only taped it for a few seconds since i couldn't get my camera to focus on the object clear enough. i then watched the object a little while longer and it eventually slowly moved heading in a slight north west direction and i lost it behind a house. having doubted myself and thinking that this sighting was anything but an extremely bright star i paid no further attention to it. two days later on tuesday 4\13\10 i went out to my backyard once again to feed my dogs and again i viewed the same object in roughly the same area. at this point i thought to myself that this must be a star, however i still wasn't completely convinced. so after feeding my dogs i grabbed my camera and made my best attempts at video taping the object. again the size of the object had me thinking i was watching a plane but having lived here as long as i have i pretty much know the areas with all the air traffic. the lights on the object also got me thinking it was a plane but the more i watched it the more i realized that the lights seemed to be rotating on the craft. i don't have a tripod so the video is extremely shaky and the camera had a very difficult time focusing on it. i changed the camera to manual focus but when it was on manual focus i was unable to see the object at all through the lens. as i watched the object with the naked eye i realized it was starting to move ever so slightly. it first moved as if it were coming closer as in heading in an east direction and then south-east. the object then seemed to slightly move north but the movements were so subtle and minute that if it weren't for stars and planets positioned in the sky i wouldn't have noticed the movement. i taped the object for about 7 minutes off and on. i started tape at 10:10 pm and stopped taping at 10:25 pm. i continued to watch the object for another 20 minutes or so as it seemed to head west and eventually i lost sight of it behind the same house. this time i decided to go to the front yard and see what i could see from there and the object was definitely heading west and i then lost it behind some trees. i checked back the following days and there was no sign of the thing i saw. i found the stars and planet that i used to map out where the object had been on those 2 nights yet the object was no longer there. i'm still unsure of what i saw. having seen objects of unknown origin in the past i'm not exactly surprised but at the same time i don't want to jump to conclusions. i showed the tape to my brother and my wife and they both think it doesn't look or behave like a man-made aircraft and the lights seem too controlled and bright to be a star and too bright and blinky to be a planet. (if you would like to see video i only have it on an analogue video tape. my digital camera would have never been able to catch sight of it.)
Summary: A White ball of light with red & bluish green light rotating around it in the western sky seen on 2 nights (4/11 & 4/13).
